comment.author: 8348059@N02
comment._content: I believe the spelling in the photo's caption is "Capt. Von Krosigk".

comment.author: 72646284@N00
comment._content: Wonder if he's any relation to this man? The wiki makes mention of the Iron Cross award en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lutz_Schwerin_von_Krosigk

comment.author: 10799299@N00
11572312@N00
comment._content: There was a German naval officer named Capt. Krosigk also, who visited New York commanding the Stettin in 1912. KAISER'S WARSHIPS SAIL TO VISIT US; Kiel Cheers the Departing Battleship-Cruiser Moltke and Germany's Pride Goes with It. Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES. May 12, 1912, Sunday query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C07E6DB103AE633A... In 1911 (the previous year) there is mention of an Admiral von Krosigk here: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9903E4D61131E233A...

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thank you. Looks like "Capt. Von Krosigk" to me too. Will submit for correction.

comment.author: 45597444@N00
comment._content:
The Captain is indeed Wilhelm von Krosigk (1871-1953), commander of the "Stettin." Medals and decorations are still with his German offspring. As well as an almost identical portrait (except for the chair in the front). 

Thank you for making the neccessary corrections with regard to his name.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: cvkm: Thank you for the additional information about von Krosigk and his dates.  We will update the source data and reload the description.
